turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You rigged the illusion to fail, right?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You paid off the doctor.  You set up the fake body.  Yes?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: And then... because I was getting too close to something --  --or someone, you called Swann

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: I tried to pay you off.

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: No.  It was mine.  I didn't want any more bloodshed. That's why we went to all this trouble, so there'd be no one for Nix to come after.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Nix is dead and buried, for fuck's sake.

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: Haven't you seen enough to know that doesn't matter?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I want to see Swann face to face.

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: Why don't you leave this alone? Let everybody think it's over?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: We've got to get you to a hospital.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Shut up.  We've lost enough lives already.

turns.speaker: VALENTIN
turns.text: ... Looks like you're going... to lose... one more.

turns.speaker: TOFFLER
turns.text: Jennifer's only ever had one visitor.

turns.speaker: TOFFLER
turns.text: Right.  And he's dead, isn't he?  I saw it on the news. Jennifer doesn't know.  And frankly, this isn't the best tine for her to be told.

turns.speaker: TOFFLER
turns.text: Jennifer's been with us four years. She was coming on nicely. But just the last month or so, she's worse than ever.

turns.speaker: TOFFLER
turns.text: She has no real grip on reality.

turns.speaker: TOFFLER
turns.text: Oh yes.  We have to agree what's real and what's not. That's what holds us together.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: And what does Jennifer think's real?

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: Too late.  Why are you here? Did you cone... up here for a reading?

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: You've taken some strange journeys in your life.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: You're drawn to the dark side, over and over.  And it's drawn to you.  You don't like that.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: You can't change it.  You have to walk...  ...walk the line between Heaven and Hell.  It's your destiny.  Accept it.

turns.speaker: QUAID
turns.text: I'm not afraid to die.  There's something terrible... coming home...

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: At birth.  I don't know you --

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: I know all the kids coming up. Got to stay ahead of the game. But I don't know you.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm in from New York.  I came to see Swann.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: What a tragedy.  It was just a matter of time, of course, but it's not good for the business.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Was he taking a lot of risks?

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: You don't know the half of it. I'm Walter Wilder, by the way.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: He knew Swann way back.  He says there were a lot of drugs, a lot of crazy shit.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'd love to... you know... hang with some of you guys.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: People are pretty cagey.  Who do you know?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I only wear ties for funerals.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: You don't get in without one. It's like a gentlemen's club for illusionists.  Except most of us aren't gentlemen.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Are they all in the business?

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: It's not a business. Harry. It's a vocation.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: That's what they call the Repository.  Every magic secret known to man's locked up in that room.

turns.speaker: WILDER
turns.text: No.  There's only three keys. Vinovich has got one, of course.  He's a little crazy, by the way. And he's a mean drunk. Otherwise, he's a real charmer.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: A lot of people are going to be really pissed off when they discover you're still alive.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: You shouldn't have followed me, D'Amour.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: How the fuck do you do that?

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Now I'm going to have to kill you.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I don't think so.  You need me alive.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Why?  So you can fuck my wife?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You know, it's such a fucking waste.  You can do shit most of us can only dream about, and you go around pretending it's some trick.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Illusionists get. Las Vegas contracts, D'Amour.  Magicians get burned.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Maybe he doesn't see it that way. Maybe he's digging his way out of the hole you put him right now.  That's what you're hiding away from, isn't it?

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Now that I'm dead, the spotlight's off her.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: So Nix won't come looking for her?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: And she shot him I  I think that'd piss me off if I were Nix.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: I don't know what else to do.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: I can do a lot of shit, D'Amour. But you know that.  So I like playing games with people.  Gives them something to wonder about...

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: I distract them from their banality for a few minutes. It's like a public service.  It doesn't mean much in the end. They're all going to die.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Oh, I was going to discover the secret of the universe.  That's why I liked Nix.  He promised me all these explanations.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: He had something.  He showed me how to bend the rules.  A little levitation.  A few fireworks.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: No.  At the end... when we had him cornered, he got into my head. He showed me what we really look like, when the veneer's gone.  Jelly. Shit...

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: I saw it with my own fucking eyes! See, that's his best trick.  No illusions.  Just the truth.  Are you ready for that?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Did she know where Nix was buried?

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: You don't get it, do you? We're shit. D'Amour.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: In my time, and nobody else's.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Jesus... what the hell's going on in there?

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: At a guess... they just resurrected him.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: This is where we killed him.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: I can't... I can't go any further...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: He did something with the ground.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: The case is closed. Harry. Tapert's given us a full confession.  Get your ass back to Mew York.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: No.  I'm taking a couple of weeks' vacation.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: You never took a fucking vacation in your life, Harry. What's going on?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I got to go.  I'm late.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: There's other guys as good as me, Loomis.

turns.speaker: LOOMIS
turns.text: Yeah.  But not as cheap.  Call me.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: Only I forget.  They give me pills, you know, to keep me... even... and... I forget things,

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well, you didn't forget me.  I just came because I wanted to know if you knew a man called Butterfield.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I knew Swann.  He's a fucking liar.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: He said he knew how to protect us. But he didn't know anything.  He made us think it was over and done with.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: I don't want to think about it. If I think about it he'll hear me. He'll find me.

turns.speaker: JENNIFER
turns.text: No.  He's coming back.  He's digging his way out!

turns.speaker: NIX
turns.text: I've got so much power to give you, Swann.  All you have to do is...beg.

turns.speaker: NIX
turns.text: You don't think I've got it to give?

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Don't touch me.  He's got... got into my head.

turns.speaker: NIX
turns.text: You want to be like that, Swann? Mud and shit?

turns.speaker: NIX
turns.text: I should have been honest with you, right from the start.  I wasn't born to show people the error of their ways.  I was born to murder the world.

turns.speaker: NIX
turns.text: You could still help me do that.

turns.speaker: NIX
turns.text: Because you've got nothing else to live for.

turns.speaker: NIX
turns.text: The woman has a new love in her life.  Your friends are dead. Nobody's left to save you, but me

turns.speaker: NIX
turns.text: You know I'll kill you when we're done.  I have to.

turns.speaker: NIX
turns.text: But until then... it's you and me... the way it always was.

turns.speaker: NIX
turns.text: Wait... you still feel something for that bitch?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Can you get me on a flight Thursday night?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: We're looking into it Bob, but they really want you to stay to do that talk show Friday, apparently it's a really big deal, he's the Johnny Carson of Japan.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: These people are paying you a lot, do you think you could consider it?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Just get me out of here as soon as you can.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ok, you're scheduled to leave Saturday, but we'll hold a seat Thursday in case, but first class is full, you're waitlisted for an upgrade... there might be a seat on Lufthansa...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Oh, great. I'll talk to you later, bye.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: So, we got you on an earlier flight, but I really think you should think about staying for that talk show.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: My wife needs space, I don't know my kids ' birthdays.  Everyone wants Tiger Woods, but they could get me, so I'm here doing a whiskey commercial.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: What about you? Why are you here?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: My husband's here for work-he's a photographer- and I just came along...I'm not really doing anything right now, and we have some friends who live here.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: How long have you been married?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: You're probably just having a mid- life crisis. Did you buy a Porche?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: 25 years... that's a long time... Are you still in love with your wife?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Yes... I don't know, I don't know her anymore. I don't know if you can be in love with one person the whole time. I was... actually I was in love with her sister first, when I was twenty-one. And one day her sister said to me she wanted to move to Paris, so I said okay, and she said no, she wanted to move to Paris with Francois,   and she's still married to him. And I moved in with Lydia... but I always really liked Lydia.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: I'm not sure, yet... I graduated last spring.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Oh, what do you do with that?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: I don't know, but I can think about it, a lot.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: It takes a while to figure it out. I'm sure you will, though.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Thanks. I'm sure your mid-life crisis will work out,too.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Who do I have to fuck to get off this planet?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Hi. Did you have a nice swim?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Yeah. Did you get some sleep?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Not really. How long are you here for?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Oh, good. Do you want to go to a party tonight with me and some friends who live here?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: You really are having a mid-life crisis.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: A Soul's Search: Finding Your True Calling - are you reading this?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Charlie, this is Bob. Bob  Charlie Brown.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: What do you feel like singing, Bob?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: I could cut the ones that are left for you.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: I don't want to go home.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Thanks for getting me back in one piece.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Do you want to have some breakfast?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Yeah, I'm going to take a shower and I'll meet you downstairs.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Hans was very attentive to you.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: I think he kind of liked me...Is that so hard to imagine?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: How'd a Japanese guy get a name like Hans?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Do you remember when we met at the bar? ...You were wearing a tuxedo.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: But the first time I saw you was in the elevator.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I know, I kind of blend in here.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Why do they switch the r's and l's here?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I don't know. My fax said "have a good fright".

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Let's never come here again, because it would never be as much fun.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Did you see Hiromix last night dancing with Bambi?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: No, I was looking at you.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Oh.  Well... they were dancing on the couch with that weird English guy who kept talking about hanging out with the Sex Pistols on Kings Road...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I got a fax today from your friend Hiromix.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: No, for a candlelight dinner, yes, for her show.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: I'm stuck. Does it get easier.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Thanks. It does, the more you know who you are... you don't care about things the same way...

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: I just don't know what I'm supposed to be. I thought maybe I wanted to be a writer... but I hate what I write, and I tried taking pictures, but John's so good at that, and mine are so mediocre... and every girl goes through a photography phase, like horses, you know dumb pictures of your feet...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You'll figure it out. I'm not worried about you. Keep writing.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: And marriage, does that get easier?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: It's hard. We started going to a marriage counselor.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Did that help? Did you learn anything?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: We established that we have no communication.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: We used to have fun, she used to like to go to places with me for my movies and we would laugh at all the weirdos, but now she's tired of it all. She never wants to leave the kids, she doesn't need me, and they don't need me, I feel like I'm in the way. It gets complicated when you have kids... that changes everything.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: When they're born its like Vietnam. It's terrifying.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: No one ever tells you that...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: But, it's great being with them, after they can talk, and can do things with you.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: That's nice. My parents were always traveling, they weren't around so much.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: In D.C., my dad was the Ambassador to France in the eighties, so we went to school in Paris for a few years... but we mostly lived in D.C., and they were never around... and then I moved to Los Angeles when John and I got married... it's so different there.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: I know, but that's what you like about me.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Why do you have to be with your opposite, why cant similar people be together?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Because that would be too easy.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: They really have to work on that street name thing.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: I don't know, I think maybe I broke it? I knocked into something the other day...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: We should get you to the doctor.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Do you know where we are?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: I'm going to Daikanyama, do you want to come walk around?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Yes, but no, I can't right now.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Oh, I guess you're busy, huh.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: You can't get sushi anywhere in Japan after 2 o'clock. Did you know that?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: No, we'll find something around here.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Well, I guess she's more around your age...  You guys could talk about things in common, like growing up in the fifties.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: You're a brat, wasn't there anyone else around to lavish you with attention?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: What do you want to drink?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: That lunch was the worst, huh.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: That's what you said the other night.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Well, I mean it more now.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I don't want to go back tomorrow.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: I know. But, it doesn't last, you have to go back sometime.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: I don't know, it just doesn't, reality changes things....we can't stay here forever, unless maybe we started a Jazz band.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I'm just leaving.... do you have my jacket?

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Uh, yeah... I'll bring it down.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Just saying good-bye to everyone before you leave?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Lydia, I went to this great house tonight, this guy designed and built, you would have loved it.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Oh, yeah? I wish I had seen it.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: He was this fashion guy, and there were all these Japanese fashion people- it's a whole other world, and I was talking to these Japanese surfers... He was playing all this great music- I have to find out what it was...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: That sounds great  can you hold on...  What Zoe?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Well, that's good, I have to get the kids off for school.  Can I call you in a little while?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: It's four in the morning... I'm going to go to sleep.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I love you, too, good-night, or good- morning .

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: It's really hard to reach you... Did you get the carpet samples? I like the burgundy.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Ok, whatever you think... I'm lost.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: That's not what I'm talking about.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Is there anything I can do?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I don't know... I want to be more healthy. I want to eat better.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Why don't you just stay there, and you can have it everyday.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: I have to go, Adam's tormenting Zoe, I'll talk to you later. Are you going to be Ok?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I couldn't hear you. How are you?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Do you want to talk to  Zoe?

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Zoe, come say hello to your father...

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Her ballet recital is Saturday, don't forget.

turns.speaker: LYDIA
turns.text: Ok, well, travel safely. See you soon.

turns.speaker: RECEPTION
turns.text: Mr. Harris, we have fax for you!

turns.speaker: RECEPTION
turns.text: Do you want I send it to your room?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: How do you say "hospital" in Japanese?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: Its just a pseudonym, it doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Why do you have to defend her?

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I'm not, but do you have to point out how stupid everyone is.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: No, I thought it was funny. Forget it.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: I gotta go meet Kelly for a drink downstairs. She wants to talk about some photo thing.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: Ok. Maybe I'll walk down with you.

turns.speaker: JOHN
turns.text: No, what are you talking about.

turns.speaker: CHARLOTTE
turns.text: I went to a temple today and I didn't feel anything.
